comments:
I get a 'Save Failed:Null' error every time I try to save a file in the IDE. I tried uniinstalling (deleting the 3.2.1 version of Eclipse and re-installing the latest stable build...and same error occurs.) not really sure what preferences were last modified, if any at all. Last time I used the IDE it worked fine...Any ideas? I cannot use any version of Eclipse with this error...

Caused by: com.chrysalisits.crypto.LunaException: LunaSession: slot uninitialized

This is caused by a failure in some kind of cryptography extension that you must have installed:

Caused by: com.chrysalisits.crypto.LunaException: LunaSession: slot
uninitialized
at
com.chrysalisits.crypto.LunaSession.OpenNewTokenSession(LunaSession.java:182)
at com.chrysalisits.crypto.LunaSession.<init>(LunaSession.java:191)
at com.chrysalisits.crypto.LunaSession.GetNewInstance(LunaSession.java:144)
at com.chrysalisits.crypto.LunaRandom.engineSetSeed(LunaRandom.java:38)

I saw that this was the cause of the failure, and was an error that was returned when in debugging... but why is it that I can't even open a completely new Java Project and save a simple file in it? The file I am saving is a simple 'hello world' with no security extensions involved. As mentioned, I get the error even after completely reinstalling a new version of Eclipse.

The SecureRandom class is used to create UUIDs (universal unique identifiers) for the local history store.  Any behaviour that causes interaction with local history, including setting file contents, will hit this code path.  It's not actually doing any real crypto work here, but it is just trying to instantiate SecureRandom. The runtime exception thrown by instantiating SecureRandom is causing the subsequent failures.  Perhaps you should report this to your cryptography extension provider.  If you install and use a "clean" JRE without extra cryptography extensions, you won't get this error.
